intro: Cassine aethiopica, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cassine aethiopica is often found in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and in forest understories. Its bark is thick and ridged, providing a distinctive appearance and contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
